results.title: The Hill
results.creator_credit: Sydney Lumet, Kenneth Hyman, Seven Arts and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Five British soldiers, all accused of crimes during wartime, are introduced to a prison war camp in Northern Africa during World War II. Run by a tyrannical and old-fashioned Seargent Major (Harry Andrews), the centre of the prison is a man-made “hill” on which the prisoners are routinely punished and tortured. The five new men all represent a cross-section of British society; all find themselves victimised by a sadistic prison guard (played by Ian Hendry) who uses the rhetoric of Empire and Victorian authority to brutalise the men physically and spiritually. When his victimisation goes one step too far, the prisoners must choose between staying silent and winning their freedom, or choosing to support Joe Robert (Sean Connery) who wants to see justice being served. Lumet directs this film with vicious energy, and it is an unrelenting and powerful indictment of the damage that a harsh hierarchical institution can do to men. It’s tough-mindedness and gruelling scenes of punishment and exploitation make it now seem a movie far ahead of its time. Cast also includes Sir Michael Redgrave. Based on a play by Ray Rigby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sydney Lumet, Kenneth Hyman, Seven Arts and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer

results.title: Hikikomori: alienation through technology
results.brief_description:
“In the year 2004, it was expected that 1 million young adults will withdraw from the Japanese society.” This interpretative performance piece explores Hikikomori through representational images - a sculpture of animation and art.
Performers: Yee Wei, Lester King. No dialogue, music soundtrack only.

results.title: The Hobbit
results.creator_credit: Jules Bass, Arthur Rankin Jnr and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.brief_description: Bilbo Baggins journeys into the Middle Earth, a place inhabited by Elves, dwarves, Wizards, Goblins, Dragons and Hobbits in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King. It is an adventurous journey and a battle between the forces of Evil. This animated feature based on J.R.R. Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jules Bass, Arthur Rankin Jnr and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.description:
Bilbo Baggins journeys into Middle Earth, a place inhabited by elves, dwarves, wizards, goblins, dragons and hobbits, in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King.

It’s an adventurous journey that features a battle between the forces of good and evil. This animated feature based on JRR Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).

results.title: The Orb
results.brief_description:
A 3D animated orb faces the pitfalls of a deadly industrial pinball track in this metaphorical interpretation of the creation of life.
Music by Markus Kellow.

results.title: The Highway of steel
results.creator_credit: Ralph McCromick, Harold Goodwin and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Emphasises the part played by the British Railways in the production of steel in Great Britain. How iron ore, coke for smelting, and limestone for steel manufacture are transported to the steel works. Follows the production of steel from pig iron to the finished product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph McCromick, Harold Goodwin and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: The History of pornography (E)
results.brief_description: This film documents the blazen and colourful history of pornography. It begins with primitive hard-core cave etchings, and the sublime prose and erotica of ancient China and India, progressing to the uncontrolled excesses of the Roman Empire and early European erotica. It also covers the first legalising of “porn” in Denmark, after a sexual revolution that challenged its constitutional laws. The rapid emergence of “dirty” comics and cartoons, and early underground “stag” films area also represented. The documentary finishes with an exploration of today’s mass marketing of sex.
